result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio M Cosey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) (PAC>=0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.
*Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by June 14, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: With credit for 5 (five) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio M Cosey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 AS ORALLY AMENDED:

Court ordered defendant to pay $150.00 FINE plus all applicable court costs and fees by June 14, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant's driver's license SUSPENDED for 6 months to commence FORTHWITH. Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 12 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Court sentences defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction concurrent with credit for 5 (five) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by June 14, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed;
Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan; received and filed.

Defendant Antonio M Cosey in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge orally amended to OWI 1st, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.63(1)(a), a Class U misdemeanor.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS ORALLY AMENDED AND COUNT 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

ADDRESS INFO for Antonio M Cosey
Current: 4448 N. 65th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 12-14-2015)
Prior: 2838 N 46th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Antonio M Cosey in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury trial.  Parties advised that Branch 37 is currently in trial and unable to proceed with this case on today.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antonio M Cosey in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case passed to 11am.
Recalled.
Court cannot proceed with trial today due to other cases in trial.
Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 37.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antonio M Cosey in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Final pre-trial conference held. Case remains calendared for jury trial May 20, 2015 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 37.
-From Assistant District Attorney Alex Mueller; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-State's Motion In Limine from Assistant District Attorney Alex Mueller; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Antonio M Cosey in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.    Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial.vb Conference.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON ON 2/9/15 @ 1 PM
